clinical_study.brief_title: Quick Questionnaire to Evaluate Physical Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Simplification de l'évaluation de l'Activité PHysique Par Interrogatoire Rapide

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test and validate a new questionnaire (SAPHIR) in order to get an evaluation of patients physical activity.

detailed_description.textblock:
Two questionnaires the SAPHIR and the "International Physical Activity Questionnaire" (IPAQ) are submitted (self completion) to patients referred for consultation.
Retrival of physical activity data on podometer if available

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Self completion of questionnaire in the waiting room

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of questionnaires with errors after self completion
primary_outcome.description: Estimation of the percentage of errors with 90% confidence interval Comparison of the two percentages

secondary_outcome.measure: Facility of the filling of the questionnaires
secondary_outcome.description: Ease of use évaluation for the patient using Likert scale (from "Totally agree" to "not agree at all" in 5 grades)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the SAPHIR questionnaire to the IPAQ questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation coefficient with the IPAQ questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of the SAPHIR questionnaire to the number of weekly steps for patients who have a pedometer available
secondary_outcome.description: The correlation coefficient with the number of steps will be studied

arm_group.description: Adults coming for a visit for sports activity participation and submitted the SAPHIR questionnaire

intervention.description: Scoring of the IPAQ is performed according to references. Scoring of the SAPHIR has been submitted for copyright protection (involves a series of 23 additions)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- French Native language
- Covered by the French social care system
- Be referred for a consultation to the Sports Medicine Service of Angers Hospital or to the CRSS of Angers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Person opposed to participating in the research
- Person unable to understand the objectives of the study
